Package database

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.Database
  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    The Database-class is the class that does all the direct communication between the java-application and the database.

      The method gets the upgrade level for all the properties that is bought from the database and update it local for the current player.

        public static int checkPassword​(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String password)
        This method attempts to log in the user.
        Parameters:
        username - The username is the local players input when loging in.
        password - The password is the local players input when loging in.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

        Parameters:
        email - The email is the local players input when trying to register.
        username - The username is the local players input when trying to register.
        password - The password is the local players input when trying to register.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • emailAvailable

        private static boolean emailAvailable​(java.lang.String email)
        This method check if an email address already is registered in the database
        Parameters:
        email - The email address that is being checked
        Returns:
        Returns false if the email already in use, and true if it's available.

      • usernameAvailable

        private static boolean usernameAvailable​(java.lang.String username)
        This method checks if an username is available, or already is registered in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The username that is being checked.
        Returns:
        Returns false if the username already is in use, and true if its available.

        position - Takes the new position for the player.

      • setMessage

        public static int setMessage​(int gameId,
                             java.lang.String username,
                             java.lang.String msg)
        This method writes a new chat message to the database.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The gameId is the id of the game the message is connected to.
        username - The username is the username of the player that write the message.
        msg - The msg is a string with the message that is written.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • getMessageId

        public static int getMessageId​(int gameId)
        This method gets the last/greatest messageId for a specific game from the database.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The gameId is the id of the game the messageId is connected to.
        Returns:
        The method returns the last/greatest messageId.

      • getLastMessage

        public static java.lang.String getLastMessage​(int gameId)
        This method gets the last message written to the database for a specific game.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The gameId is the id of the game the messageId is connected to.
        Returns:
        The method returns a string with the last message, or null if there are no messages.

      • getUsername

        private static java.lang.String getUsername​(java.lang.String email)
        This method gets an username given an email address from the database.
        Parameters:
        email - The email address that you want the username for.
        Returns:
        The method returns a string with the email, or null if the email address isn't registered.

        Parameters:
        username - The username for the player.
        nickname - The nickname that shall be changed to.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

                                 java.lang.String password)
        The method changes the password for a specific user in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The username for player.
        password - The new password to be set.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • updatePassword

        public static int updatePassword​(java.lang.String email,
                                 java.lang.String password)
        The method changes the password to a randomly generated password in the database if the email address is registered, and send the password to the mail address given.
        Parameters:
        email - The mail address that is registered to the user.
        password - The new password to the user.
        Returns:
        he method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • getOpponents

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Player> getOpponents​(int gameID,
                                                       Player player)
        The method gets a list of opponents within the same game as a the local player from the database.
        Parameters:
        gameID - The gameID of the local game.
        player - The local player.
        Returns:
        The method returns an ArrayList of opponent.

      • setLock

        public static int setLock​(java.lang.String username,
                          int lock)
        This method updates a lock variable in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the player where the lock is updated.
        lock - The value of the lock, 0 if false/not locked and 1 if true/locked.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • getNextPlayer

        private static java.lang.String getNextPlayer​(int gameID,
                                              java.lang.String username)
        The method gets the next player in a game to take a turn form the database.
        Parameters:
        gameID - The gameId is the id for current game.
        username - The username is the username of the current player.
        Returns:
        The method returns the username of the next player.

      • endTurn

        public static int endTurn​(int gameID,
                          java.lang.String username)
        This method ends the turn for the active player by setting the next player to take a turn as active player to the database.
        Parameters:
        gameID - The gameId is the id of the current game.
        username - The username is the username of the player that ends the turn.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • setStarted

        public static int setStarted​(int gameID,
                             boolean state)
        This method updates the started variable for a given game in the database.
        Parameters:
        gameID - The gameId of the game to update.
        state - The state of the variable, true if started and false if not started.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • connectToGame

        public static int connectToGame​(java.lang.String username)
        This method check if the player is in the database, if not then put it in. Then connects a player to a game, by finding a game with free space that is not started, or creating a new game if there are no games that could be joined. It then sets the player in the game in the database, and if needed creates the game in database.
        Parameters:
        username - The username is the username for the local player.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • getActivePlayer

        public static Player getActivePlayer​(int gameID)
        This method gets the active player form a given game from the database.
        Parameters:
        gameID - The gameId is the id of the game where you want the active player from.
        Returns:
        The method returns the active from the current game.

      • logOut

        public static int logOut​(int gameID,
                         java.lang.String username)
        This method removes the player and objects connected to the player form the database.
        Parameters:
        gameID - The gameId is the id of the game where the player logout from.
        username - The username is the username of the player to logout.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • checkIfStarted

        public static int checkIfStarted​(int gameID)
        This method gets the started variable from the database.
        Parameters:
        gameID - The gameId of the game to check.
        Returns:
        The method returns 0 if the game is not started and 1 if it is started, and a negative int if a database error occurred.

      • payRent

        public static int payRent​(Property property)
        This method update the money in the database for the active player that have to pay, and the player that owns the property the rent is payed for.
        Parameters:
        property - The property is the property the rent is payed for.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • buyPropertyDb

        public static int buyPropertyDb​(int gameId,
                                Property property,
                                int upgrade,
                                java.lang.String username)
        This method updates the database when a player buy a property by updating the property object and the players balance.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The gameId is the id of the current game.
        property - The property is the property the player buy.
        upgrade - The upgrade sets the upgrade level for the property.
        username - The username is the username of the player that buy the property.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • checkOwnership

        public static java.lang.String checkOwnership​(int gameId,
                                              int position)
        This method check the database and gets the owner form a property if it is owned.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The gameId is the id of the current game.
        position - The position is the position of the property checked.
        Returns:
        The method returns a string with the username of the owner if any, or null if no owner.

      • updateUpgradeDB

        public static int updateUpgradeDB​(int gameId,
                                  Property property,
                                  int price,
                                  int lvl)
        The method update the upgrade level for a property and the balance of the player that buys it the in the database.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The gameId is the id of the current game.
        property - The property is the property where the upgrade is updated.
        price - The price is the price of the upgrade.
        lvl - The lvl is the new level of the upgrade.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • getUpgrades

        public static int getUpgrades​(Property[] properties,
                              int gameID)
        The method gets the upgrade level for all the properties that is bought from the database and update it local for the current player.
        Parameters:
        properties - The properties is an array of all the bought properties in the current game.
        gameID - The gameId is the id of the current game.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • sellProperty

        public static int sellProperty​(Property property,
                               int gameID,
                               java.lang.String username)
        The method updates the property and the players balance in the database when a player sells a property.
        Parameters:
        property - The property that the current player sells.
        gameID - The gameId is the id of the current game.
        username - The username is the username of the current player.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • deleteMessage

        public static int deleteMessage​(int gameId)
        The method deleted all the messages connected to a player form the database.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The gameId is the id of the current game. //*@param username The username is the username of the current player.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.

      • updateBalance

        public static int updateBalance​(java.lang.String username,
                                int money)
        The method update the balance in the database for the current player.
        Parameters:
        username - The username is the username of the current player.
        money - The money is the amount to be changed. Positive if adding and negative if withdraw money.
        Returns:
        The method returns an integer based on the result of the method.
